Function Documentation

EDITORCONFIG_EXPORT void editorconfig_get_version ( int *  major,
int *  minor,
int *  subminor 
)

Get the version number of EditorConfig.

An example is available at src/bin/main.c in EditorConfig source code.

Parameters:
major If not null, the integer pointed by major will be filled with the major version of EditorConfig.
minor If not null, the integer pointed by minor will be filled with the minor version of EditorConfig.
subminor If not null, the integer pointed by subminor will be filled with the subminor version of EditorConfig.
Returns:
None.
EDITORCONFIG_EXPORT int editorconfig_parse ( const char *  full_filename,
editorconfig_parsing_out *  out,
char **  err_file 
)

Parse editorconfig files corresponding to the file path given by full_filename, and put the result to "out".

An example is available at src/bin/main.c in editorconfig source code.

Parameters:
full_filename The full path of a file that is edited by the editor for which the parsing result is.
out The parsing result will be filled in out, which is a editorconfig_parsing_out structure. This structure needs to be cleared by editorconfig_parsing_out_clear if this function succeeds.
err_file When a parsing error occured, this will point to a file that caused the parsing error.
Return values:
0 Everything is OK;
-2 The full_filename is not a full path name;
-3 A memory error occurs;
>0 A parsing error occurs. The return value would be the line number of parsing error. If err_file is not NULL, err_file will also be filled with the file path that caused the parsing error.
EDITORCONFIG_EXPORT int editorconfig_parsing_out_clear ( editorconfig_parsing_out *  epo  ) 

Clear the editorconfig_parsing_out structure after a success call of editorconfig_parse.

An example is available at src/bin/main.c in editorconfig source code.

Parameters:
epo The editorconfig_parsing_out structure to be cleared.
Return values:
zero Everything is OK
non-zero Some error occured.
Note:
Currently this function always returns 0, but please make a return value checking to make the code compatible with future versions.
